greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: List of triples (i,j,k) (i>=0, j>=0, k>= 0) in canonical order used to convert an infinite tetrahedron of numbers to a linear sequence.
comment: The triples are sorted first according to their sum, then by the value of k, then by the value of j.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, The 6545 triples with i+j+k <= 32
maple: for k from 0 to n do
for j from 0 to n do
for i from 0 to n do
xref: Cf. A144627-A144629 for the individual columns.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 18 2009
